workflow_name: Indeed Job Search - Targeted Role Discovery
description: Automated Indeed search with Customer Journey Leader evaluation framework. Surfaces Head/Director/VP roles at early-to-growth-stage VC-backed B2B SaaS companies where founder-led customer relationships are breaking down.

evaluation_framework.name: Customer Journey Leader Lens
evaluation_framework.description: At seed/Series A companies, evaluate for 'customer journey leader' — the first customer-facing hire who owns the entire post-sale relationship: onboarding, success, support, retention, and feedback-to-product.
evaluation_framework.key_question: Is this company approaching the moment where founder-led customer relationships break down?
inflection_signals: Growing logo count with increasing complexity
Founder still doing support but shipping product rapidly
Customer-facing differentiators in marketing (e.g., 'white-glove support', 'US-based support')

search_queries.search: Head of Customer Support B2B SaaS
search_queries.notes: Highest signal query - found Measured role

search_queries.search: Head of Customer Experience B2B SaaS
search_queries.notes: CX-titled roles often have full post-sales scope at early stage
Customer Success at early stage often = full customer journey ownership
Healthcare SaaS is priority sector - broad 'Customer' title captures journey leader roles
Healthcare SaaS is a priority sector

search_queries.search: Head of Customer Support developer tools
search_queries.notes: Developer tools is a priority sector
VP-level postings, may skew larger companies
Long shot - some startups use this language for 0-to-1 roles

scheduling.rotation_strategy: Run all high-priority queries daily, medium every 2 days, low every 3 days
scheduling.notes: Indeed job_id from search results is the primary dedup field. Track seen IDs in Airtable to avoid reprocessing.

disqualifier_hierarchy.description: Enforce in this exact order. Stop evaluation at first disqualifier hit.

order.label: PE-backed company
order.notes: PE-backed is the single strongest disqualifier. Check FIRST before any other logic.

order.label: Role is primarily renewals/AM/sales, not support/CX
order.context_notes: If these are PRIMARY success metrics (not secondary), disqualify. CS roles that mention renewals as one metric among many are OK.

order.label: Healthcare role requires payer-side expertise (not provider-side)
order.notes: Candidate background is provider-side (Alliance HealthCare). Payer-side requires different domain knowledge.

order.label: Total funding < $500K and not in target sector
order.notes: Exception: if in target sector AND approaching Series A, flag as WATCH instead

order.label: Company size < 5 people AND pre-seed
order.notes: Flag as 'too early' - revisit in 6-12 months. Cannot support $125K+ comp yet.

positive_signals.description: Signals that increase score. Weight: VERY_HIGH > HIGH > MEDIUM > LOW

signals.description: Explicit open role for customer/support leadership
Healthcare SaaS - protected niche, domain expertise match
Developer tools - target sector, especially with enterprise plan
Named enterprise customers - signals PMF and support complexity
Series A or B stage - sweet spot for first customer-facing hire
Seed with top-tier VCs (YC, a16z, GC, Sequoia, First Round) - Series A likely coming
signals.output_hint: Good for WATCH list if no open role

signals.description: 'Support' or 'customer experience' mentioned as company differentiator
Team 10-50, mostly engineering - approaching CX hire inflection
Pharma/biotech/clinical customer base - maps to Alliance HealthCare experience

negative_signals.description: Signals that decrease score or trigger disqualification

signals.description: Hardware or hardware+software hybrid - SaaS experience doesn't transfer
SMB-only pricing (< $500/mo) - may not need enterprise support leader
Founder stepped down / CEO replaced - past the building phase
Website redirecting to different entity - pivot/wind-down signal

three_bucket_output.description: Scoring outputs one of three buckets

buckets.name: APPLY
buckets.criteria: Open role exists OR company is at the CX hire inflection point, in target sector, meets all qualifiers

buckets.name: WATCH
buckets.criteria: Right sector and trajectory but 3-12 months premature. Flag for revisit.
buckets.action: Add to watch list, check monthly

buckets.name: PASS
buckets.criteria: Hits disqualifier(s) or fundamental sector/stage mismatch

soft_scoring.description: Score 0-10 on each dimension. Total determines APPLY/WATCH/PASS bucket.

dimensions.name: build_opportunity
dimensions.description: Is this a 0-to-1 or early-stage build? Score 10 for greenfield/first hire, 7 for small team (1-3), 4 for scaling existing team, 2 for managing established org, 0 for PE-playbook optimization.

dimensions.name: company_stage
dimensions.description: Series A or B is sweet spot. Score 10 for Seed/A, 8 for Series B, 5 for Series C, 2 for Series D+, 0 for late stage/public/PE.

dimensions.name: company_size
dimensions.description: 10-50 employees is ideal inflection point. Score 10 for 10-30, 8 for 30-50, 6 for 50-100, 4 for 100-200, 2 for 200-500, 0 for 500+.
dimensions.notes: Under 10 may be too early (WATCH). Over 500 is too late.

dimensions.name: title_level
dimensions.description: VP/Head/SVP preferred, Director acceptable. Score 10 for SVP/VP/Head, 7 for Director, 3 for Senior Manager, 0 for Manager.

dimensions.name: sector_fit
dimensions.description: Healthcare SaaS and developer tools are priority. Score 10 for healthcare SaaS (provider-side), 10 for life sciences/clinical, 9 for developer tools with enterprise plan, 7 for technical B2B SaaS, 5 for general B2B SaaS, 0 for DTC/consumer/defense/hardware.

dimensions.name: compensation_fit
dimensions.description: Base above $125K preferred. Score 10 for $150K+, 8 for $140-150K, 6 for $125-140K, 4 for $110-125K with strong equity, 2 for under $110K, 0 for under $100K.
dimensions.notes: Flexible for exceptional build opportunity in target sector

dimensions.name: technical_complexity
dimensions.description: Enterprise B2B with technical product preferred. Score 10 for APIs/data/clinical/infrastructure, 8 for enterprise SaaS with integrations, 5 for mid-market SaaS, 3 for simple SaaS, 0 for non-technical.

dimensions.name: customer_journey_scope
dimensions.description: Does role own full post-sale journey? Score 10 for onboarding+success+support+retention, 7 for 2-3 of these, 4 for narrow support only, 0 for renewals/AM focus.

ai_classification_prompt.description: Send this prompt along with the job listing details to Claude API for classification.
ai_classification_prompt.system_prompt: You are evaluating job listings using the Customer Journey Leader framework. At seed/Series A companies, evaluate for 'customer journey leader' — the first customer-facing hire who owns the entire post-sale relationship. Be STRICT on disqualifiers (check PE-backing FIRST). Be conservative on scoring. Output three buckets: APPLY, WATCH, or PASS.
ai_classification_prompt.user_prompt_template:
Evaluate this job listing for fit.

**Candidate Profile:**
VP/Head-level customer leader with 13+ years experience building support organizations from scratch (0-to-1) at B2B SaaS companies. Healthcare experience is PROVIDER-SIDE (Alliance HealthCare - medical imaging to hospitals/clinics), NOT payer-side. Targeting early-stage VC-backed companies where he can be the founding customer hire or build the function.

**Job Details:**
Job Title: {{job_title}}
Company: {{company_name}}
Job Description: {{job_description}}
Company Size: {{employee_count}} (if known)
Funding: {{funding_info}} (if known)
Compensation: {{compensation}} (if known)
Location: {{location}}

**STEP 1: DISQUALIFIER CHECK (in order)**
Check each disqualifier. If ANY are true, return PASS with reason.

1. PE-backed? (Look for: private equity, PE-backed, portfolio company, known PE firms like Accel-KKR, Vista, Thoma Bravo, LLR Partners, etc.)
2. Fortune 500 / 1000+ employees / $500M+ funding or valuation?
3. Sector mismatch? (DTC, consumer products, retail, defense, government, hardware, agtech, commodity trading)
4. Role primarily renewals/AM/sales? (Primary metrics: NRR, GRR, expansion ARR, upsell, quota)
5. Payer-side healthcare? (health plans, insurance, claims, utilization management)
6. No remote option?

**STEP 2: IF NOT DISQUALIFIED, SCORE (0-10 each)**
- build_opportunity: 10=0-to-1 first hire, 7=small team, 4=scaling, 2=inherited org, 0=PE optimization
- company_stage: 10=Seed/A, 8=Series B, 5=C, 2=D+, 0=late/PE
- company_size: 10=10-30 people, 8=30-50, 6=50-100, 4=100-200, 2=200-500, 0=500+
- title_level: 10=SVP/VP/Head, 7=Director, 3=Sr Manager, 0=Manager
- sector_fit: 10=healthcare SaaS or life sciences, 9=dev tools, 7=technical B2B SaaS, 5=general B2B SaaS, 0=mismatched
- compensation_fit: 10=$150K+, 8=$140-150K, 6=$125-140K, 4=$110-125K, 2=under $110K
- technical_complexity: 10=APIs/clinical/data, 8=enterprise integrations, 5=mid-market, 3=simple, 0=non-tech
- customer_journey_scope: 10=owns full post-sale, 7=2-3 areas, 4=narrow support, 0=renewals focus

**STEP 3: DETERMINE BUCKET**
- Total 50+: APPLY
- Total 35-49: WATCH (right trajectory but premature)
- Total <35 OR disqualified: PASS

**STEP 4: RETURN JSON**
{
  "bucket": "APPLY" | "WATCH" | "PASS",
  "disqualifiers_checked": [{"rule": "...", "result": "pass|fail", "evidence": "..."}],
  "disqualified": true|false,
  "disqualify_reason": "<if disqualified>",
  "scores": {"build_opportunity": N, ...},
  "total_score": N,
  "max_possible": 80,
  "positive_signals": ["<list strong signals>"],
  "red_flags": ["<list concerns>"],
  "summary": "<2-3 sentence explanation>",
  "watch_triggers": ["<if WATCH, what would trigger APPLY>"],
  "missing_info": ["<fields to research>"]
}

airtable.description: Store all results in Airtable for tracking and dedup

watch_list_management.description: How to manage WATCH bucket companies
watch_list_management.promotion_criteria: If revisit trigger fires AND company now scores 50+, promote to APPLY

examples.reason: Healthcare domain match (life sciences/clinical), Series B, SVP/VP role, enterprise B2B customers (pharma/biotech), VC-backed
Explicit Head of Customer Support role, B2B SaaS, Series B, right company size, VC-backed
Developer tools (target sector), top-tier VCs (YC, GC), enterprise customers, but Seed stage, ~15 people, no customer roles yet. Revisit at Series A.
PE-backed + DTC/consumer products + retail distribution - multiple disqualifiers
Defense tech + hardware + government customers - sector mismatch
